required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating A 13-Valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine Administered To Infants In Korea
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 2, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Double-Blind Trial Evaluating The Safety, Tolerability, And Immunogenicity Of A 13-Valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine In Healthy Infants Given With Routine Pediatric Vaccinations In Korea

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of a 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC), relative to a 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) when given concomitantly with routine vaccines in Korea.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serotype-specific Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Antibody Level Greater Than or Equal to (≥) 0.35 Micrograms Per Milliliter (Mcg/mL) Measured 1 Month After the Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the infant series (7 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35 Mcg/mL along with the corresponding 95 percent (%) confidence interval (CI) was calculated for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serotype-specific IgG Antibody Level ≥0.35 Mcg/mL Measured 1 Month After the Toddler Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the toddler dose (13 months of age)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35Mcg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI was calculated for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A). Exact 2-sided CI was based on the observed percentage of participants.

intervention.description: 13vPnC is given via intramuscular injection at approximately 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age.
7vPnC is given via intramuscular injection at approximately 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy 2-month-old-infants (42 to 98 days)
- Available for the entire study period (14 months)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous vaccine with pneumococcal, diptheria, tetanus, pertussis, polio or Hib vaccine
- A previous severe reaction to any vaccine or vaccine-related component

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) 0.5 milliliter (mL) dose administered intramuscularly (IM) at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) 0.5 mL dose administered IM at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) 0.5 milliliter (mL) dose administered intramuscularly (IM) at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) 0.5 mL dose administered IM at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serotype-specific Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Antibody Level Greater Than or Equal to (≥) 0.35 Micrograms Per Milliliter (Mcg/mL) Measured 1 Month After the Infant Series
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35 Mcg/mL along with the corresponding 95 percent (%) confidence interval (CI) was calculated for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A).
outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the infant series (7 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable Infant Immunogenicity population: participants who were 41 to 99 days of age (inclusive) on the day of the first vaccination, who had treatments as randomized (all expected doses) and at least 1 valid and determinate assay result for proposed analysis.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) 0.5 milliliter (mL) dose administered intramuscularly (IM) at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) 0.5 mL dose administered IM at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serotype-specific Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Antibody Level Greater Than or Equal to (≥) 0.35 Micrograms Per Milliliter (Mcg/mL) Measured 1 Month After the Infant Series
measure.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35 Mcg/mL along with the corresponding 95 percent (%) confidence interval (CI) was calculated for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A).
measure.population: Evaluable Infant Immunogenicity population: participants who were 41 to 99 days of age (inclusive) on the day of the first vaccination, who had treatments as randomized (all expected doses) and at least 1 valid and determinate assay result for proposed analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serotype-specific IgG Antibody Level ≥0.35 Mcg/mL Measured 1 Month After the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35Mcg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI was calculated for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A). Exact 2-sided CI was based on the observed percentage of participants.
outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the toddler dose (13 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable Toddler Immunogenicity population:41-99 days old inclusive on day of first vaccination, 365-395 days old inclusive at toddler dose, had all treatments as randomized, blood drawn within specified timeframes, at least 1 valid and determinate assay result for proposed analysis, and no major protocol violations

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) 0.5 milliliter (mL) dose administered intramuscularly (IM) at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) 0.5 mL dose administered IM at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serotype-specific IgG Antibody Level ≥0.35 Mcg/mL Measured 1 Month After the Toddler Dose
measure.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35Mcg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI was calculated for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A). Exact 2-sided CI was based on the observed percentage of participants.
measure.population: Evaluable Toddler Immunogenicity population:41-99 days old inclusive on day of first vaccination, 365-395 days old inclusive at toddler dose, had all treatments as randomized, blood drawn within specified timeframes, at least 1 valid and determinate assay result for proposed analysis, and no major protocol violations

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Concentration (GMC) of Serotype-specific IgG Antibody 1 Month After the Infant Series
outcome.description: Antibody GMC along with corresponding 2-sided 95% CI for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented. Geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) were calculated using all participants with available data for the specified blood draw.
outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the infant series (7 months of age)

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) 0.5 milliliter (mL) dose administered intramuscularly (IM) at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) 0.5 mL dose administered IM at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Concentration (GMC) of Serotype-specific IgG Antibody 1 Month After the Infant Series
measure.description: Antibody GMC along with corresponding 2-sided 95% CI for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented. Geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) were calculated using all participants with available data for the specified blood draw.

analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 4: Ratio of geometric means (13vPnC, 7vPnC)
analysis.estimate_desc: CI for the ratio were back transformations of a CI based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithms of the measures (13vPnC, 7vPnC).

analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 6B: Ratio of geometric means (13vPnC, 7vPnC)
analysis.estimate_desc: CI for the ratio were back transformations of a CI based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithms of the measures (13vPnC, 7vPnC).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-specified Local Reactions: Infant Series Dose 1 (2 Months of Age)
outcome.description: Pre-specified local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling or redness present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (greater than [>] 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: Within 4 days after dose 1 (2 months of age)
outcome.population: Safety population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of the study vaccine; N=number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days; n=number of participants reporting the specific characteristic.

measure.description: Pre-specified local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-specified Systemic Events: Infant Series Dose 1 (2 Months of Age)
outcome.description: Pre-specified systemic events (any fever ≥ 38 degrees Celsius [C], decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, and decreased sleep) were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: Within 4 days after dose 1 (2 months of age)
outcome.population: Safety; N=number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days; n=number of participants reporting the event.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) 0.5 milliliter (mL) dose administered intramuscularly (IM) at 2, 4, and 6 months of age (infant series) and 12 months of age (toddler dose).

measure.description: Pre-specified systemic events (any fever ≥ 38 degrees Celsius [C], decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, and decreased sleep) were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: Safety; N=number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days; n=number of participants reporting the event.

class.title: Fever ≥38 degrees C but ≤39 degrees C (n=11,9)

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between treatments for fever ≥38 degrees C but but less than or equal to (≤)39 degrees C.
Comparison between treatments for decreased appetite.
Comparison between treatments for irritability.
Comparison between treatments for increased sleep.
Comparison between treatments for decreased sleep.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-specified Systemic Events: Infant Series Dose 2 (4 Months of Age)
outcome.description: Pre-specified systemic events (any fever ≥ 38 degrees Celsius [C], decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, and decreased sleep) were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: Within 4 days after dose 2 (4 months of age)
outcome.population: Safety; N=number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days; n=number of participants reporting the event.

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline through 1 Month after last study vaccination (13 Months). Local reactions and systemic events assessed within 4 days of dose: Infant Series Dose 1=2 months of age; Dose 2=4 months of age; Dose 3=6 months of age; Toddler Dose=12 months of age.
reported_events.desc: Safety population = all randomized subjects with at least 1 dose of study treatment. An Adverse Event (AE) term may be reported as both a serious and non-serious AE, but are distinct events. AE may = serious for 1 subject and = non-serious for another subject or subject may have experienced both a serious and non-serious episode of the same event.

group.title: Infant Series 13vPnC

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
